info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 1 at 6:10PM EDT until July 1 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Albany NY
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of east central New York, including the following counties, Dutchess and Ulster.
* WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 610 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Poughkeepsie, Beacon, Pawling, Milton, Plattekill, Pleasant Valley, Wappingers Falls, Highland, Fishkill, Millbrook, Hopewell Junction, Red Oaks Mill, Myers Corner, Fairview, Marlboro, Wingdale, Dover Plains, Modena, East Fishkill and Beekman. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING
